featured.text: Even the most ordinary objects can present to us powerful images.
England was probably the first country in Europe 17 ordinary people used umbrellas 18 the rain.
Sometimes it is the ordinary nature of these objects that actually makes them so extraordinary.
She was no ordinary orphan: she was an elephant.

other.text: "It’s become so everyday, so ordinary, nobody cares," he said.
The answer is: not very thoroughly, 27 they are executives, specialized experts, or ordinary people in the street.
Many ordinary clocks are hard to read early in the morning, deceiving students of the correct time, __22__ causing them to be late for school.
The ordinary woman’s leather shoe is considered unusual because _______.
The umbrella is now a very ordinary 19 .

definition.zh_def: 普通的，平常的，沒有特別之處的。
definition.en_def: Commonly encountered; not special or different.
definition.example: She wore an ordinary dress to the party.
